title: Stuff your stockings with a Microsoft Windows 11 Pro license for only $22.97.
content:
Macworld

The holidays really are a time of miracles. It’s the time of year when even the impossible might actually start to seem vaguely possible. If we told you that Black Friday made it possible for Mac lovers to land a complete Microsoft Windows 11 Pro operating system license for under $23.

No, really. Believe it. It’s the season of impossible.

Like scoring the operating system that runs 70% of the world’s personal computers at about the price it would cost to have a large pizza delivered. 

Whether you’re trying to install a new OS on a refurbished computer, or even run Windows on your Mac, this offer includes a lifetime license to run Windows 11 Pro on your laptop or PC of choice and get access to all that integrated Windows goodness.

Created with professional users in mind, Windows 11 Pro is stacked with apps, features, and other cool stuff not even available to Windows 10 users. 

Featuring a supercharged collection of new security programs, users can take advantage of apps like BitLocker Encryption, which makes your most valuable data unrecognizable without an encryption key; and Windows Information Protection, which allows work and personal data to remain separate and even includes separate permissions to use specific apps.

Be sure to double-check your computer’s specs to make sure it’s capable of running Windows 11 Pro, but if it’s up to the task, Black Friday is offering one of the lowest prices you’ll ever see on this heritage operating system. 

Right now, a full Windows 11 Pro install that can be used on up to two computers is available for only $22.97, a savings of almost 90% off the regular $199 price. Of course, you’ll need to get your purchase completed by 11:59 p.m. by Sun., Dec. 3 to get this limited-time Black Friday price.
